page.title: 14Local History The R. Stour
page.content: When we went out we saw the River Stour. It was quite bendy.It was brown,very deep in parts and shallow in other parts.The river separated Essex from Suffolk.The banks were not steep.They were grassy and quite beautiful.The water was cold.We saw two Damselflies which were blue and green. At one time barges used to go up river to the mill at Bures.The river flowed too quickly for the barges and so they cut a new channel to make the river bend instead of go straight. The county boundary had always been the river and even after the change continued to follow the old course.This has resulted in there being a small area of 4.605 acres of land which is north of the river and still in Essex.
